glsa.title: Ethereal: Multiple vulnerabilities in protocol dissectors
glsa.synopsis: Ethereal is vulnerable to numerous vulnerabilities, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Ethereal is a feature-rich network protocol analyzer.

description.p: Coverity discovered numerous vulnerabilities in versions of Ethereal prior to 0.99.0, including:

ul.li: buffer overflows in the ALCAP (CVE-2006-1934), COPS (CVE-2006-1935) and telnet (CVE-2006-1936) dissectors.
buffer overflows in the NetXray/Windows Sniffer and Network Instruments file code (CVE-2006-1934).

description.p: For further details please consult the references below.

impact.p: An attacker might be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to crash Ethereal or execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Ethereal, which could be the root user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ethereal users should upgrade to the latest version:
